titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Charles Claude Guthrie Publications, 1903-1948 UA.90.F103
titlestmt.author: Kallie Sheets.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 10:07:38 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Charles Claude Guthrie Publications
did.abstract: This is a collection of the publications of Dr. C.C. Guthrie. These publications span from the beginning of his medical career to his retirement as a professor at the University of Pittsburgh.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Charles Claude Guthrie Publications, 1903-1948, UA.90.F103, University of Pittsburgh Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Charles Claude Guthrie Publications, 1903-1948, UA.90.F103, University Archives, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Kallie Sheets in March 2017.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection of publications by C.C. Guthrie spans his career from 1903 to 1956. This includes his time spent as a professor of pharmacology and physiology at Washington University and the University of Pittsburgh, contributing to the understanding of blood vessels and grafted tissues.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: Charles Claude Guthrie was born in Gilmore, Missouri, on September 26, 1880. He graduated in 1901 from the Universtiy of Missouri with a degree in medicine and earned his Ph.D. in 1908 at the University of Chicago. From there he became a professor of pharmacology and physiology at the University of Washington before moving to the University of Pittsburgh, where he remaineded until retirement. His work included the study of suturing blood vessels, resuscitation, and ungrafted tissues. He is also known for his work with Alexis Carrel regarding vascular surgery.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the University of Pittsburgh's Falk Medical Library on July 30, 2012. This collection was separated from the Falk Library Medical School History Collection (UA.2012.28) in March 2017.
